meanings.definition: The quality or state of being strident.
meanings.sent1: The stridencies of the music made my ears hurt.
meanings.sent2: Her stridencies in the argument made it difficult to have a calm discussion.
meanings.sent3: The stridencies of the alarm clock woke me up with a jolt.
meanings.sent4: The stridencies of the car horn pierced through the noisy traffic.
meanings.sent5: I will never forget the stridencies of the teacher's voice when she was angry.

meanings.definition: The harshness or shrillness of a sound or voice.
meanings.sent1: The stridencies of the violin were too much for my sensitive ears.
meanings.sent2: His stridencies during the speech made it hard to focus on the message.
meanings.sent3: The stridencies of the cat's meow sounded more like a screech.
meanings.sent4: The stridencies of the wind howling outside kept me awake all night.
meanings.sent5: The stridencies of the microphone feedback made everyone cover their ears.
